info.title: Request for Quotation
info.description: This service enables a  remote system to read, create and update  requests for quotation from or in the SAP  S/4HANA system.

x-sap-shortText: Read, create, and update requests for quotations from or in the SAP S/4HANA system using this service

values.text: [Collaborative Manufacturing with SAP Digital Manufacturing Cloud (1NX)](https://rapid.sap.com/bp/#/scopeitems/1NX " Link To BP ")
[Sourcing with SAP Ariba Sourcing (1A0)](https://rapid.sap.com/bp/#/scopeitems/1A0 " Link To BP ")
[Supplier Quote Automation with SAP Ariba Commerce Automation (1L2)](https://rapid.sap.com/bp/#/scopeitems/1L2 " Link To BP ")

parameters.description:
Purchasing Document Number  
Alphanumeric key uniquely identifying the document.

parameters.name: PartnerCounter
parameters.description:
The sequential number that the system applies when there is more than one partner for a particular partner function.  
When you create a sales order for a particular customer, there may be more than one ship-to party defined. The different ship-to parties are numbered sequentially.

schema.example:
--request-separator
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

GET A_RequestForQuotation HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json


--request-separator--

--response-separator
Content-Type: application/http

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{...}
--response-separator--

CompanyCode.title: Company Code
CompanyCode.description: The company code is an organizational unit within financial accounting.

PurchasingDocumentCategory.title: Purch. Doc. Category
PurchasingDocumentCategory.description:
Purchasing Document Category  
Identifier that allows you to differentiate between various kinds of purchasing document in the SAP System.

CreatedByUser.title: Created By
CreatedByUser.description: Name of Person Who Created Object

CreationDate.title: Created On
CreationDate.description: Date on Which Record Was Created

Language.title: Language Key
Language.description:
The language key indicates  
- the language in which texts are displayed,- the language in which you enter texts,- the language in which the system prints texts.

PurchasingGroup.title: Purchasing Group
PurchasingGroup.description:
Key for a buyer or a group of buyers, who is/are responsible for certain purchasing activities.  
Frequently, purchasing documents (such as purchase orders) are monitored by the purchasing group. Urging letters (in the case of overdue deliveries) fall also within the group's scope of activities.For each purchasing group, statistical analyses can be performed. The purchasing group can be used as a sort criterion when creating purchasing-specific reports.

DocumentCurrency.title: Currency
DocumentCurrency.description:
Currency Key  
Currency key for amounts in the system.

IncotermsClassification.title: Incoterms
IncotermsClassification.description:
Incoterms (Part 1)  
Commonly used trading terms that comply with the standards established by the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC).  
Incoterms specify internationally recognized procedures that the shipper and the receiving party must follow for the shipping transaction to be completed successfully.If goods are shipped through a port of departure, the appropriate Incoterm might be: FOB ("Free On Board"). You can provide further details (for example, the name of the port) in the secondary Incoterm field: FOB Boston, for example.

IncotermsTransferLocation.title: Incoterms (Part 2)
IncotermsTransferLocation.description:
Additional information for the primary Incoterm.  
If the primary Incoterm is, for example, FOB ("Free on Board"), then the second field provides details of the port from which the delivery leaves (for example, "FOB Boston").

IncotermsVersion.title: Incoterms Version
IncotermsVersion.description: An incoterms version is an edition containing a list of international terms for transportation that is defined by the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC).

IncotermsLocation1.title: Incoterms Location 1
IncotermsLocation1.description:
Provides additional information for the primary Incoterm. For Incoterms 2010, this field represents:  
1. For sea and inland waterway transport - Port of Shipment2. For any mode of transport - Place of Delivery 2010Incoterms are divided as follows:Group 1: Rules for any mode or modes of transport (including by vessel)Incoterms Incoterms Description  Location 1 EXW Ex Works  Place of DeliveryFCA Free Carrier  Place of DeliveryCPT Carriage Paid To  Place of DestinationCIP Carriage & Insurance Paid To  Place of DestinationDAF Delivered at Frontier  Place of DeliveryDDP Delivered Duty Paid  Place of DestinationDDU Delivered Duty Unpaid  Place of DestinationGroup 2: Rules for sea and inland waterwaysIncoterms Incoterms Description Location 1 FAS Free Alongside Ship Port of ShipmentFOB Free On Board Port of ShipmentCFR Cost & Freight Port of DestinationCIF Cost Insurance & Freight Port of DestinationDEQ Delivered Eq Quay (Duty Paid) Port of DestinationDES Delivered Ex Ship Port of DestinationIf the primary incoterm is specified as FOB “Free on Board”, the second field provides details of the port from which the delivery leaves, such as FOB Boston.

IncotermsLocation2.title: Incoterms Location 2
IncotermsLocation2.description:
Provides additional information for the Incoterms. This field is only available for C-Clauses (if customized appropriately). Note the following for the incoterms versions below:  
No Version:This field is disabledIncoterm Version 2000This field is disabled as part of standard delivery unless a customer decides to enable it by the way of Customizing for Sales and Distribution under Master Data -> Business Partners -> Customers -> Billing Document -> Incoterms -> Map Incoterms to Versions.Incoterm Version 2010For this version, the field represents:Sea and inland waterway transport - Port of DestinationAny mode of transport - Place of Destination2010 Incoterms are divided as follows:Group 1: Rules for any mode or modes of transport (including by vessel)Incoterms Incoterms Description Location 2CPT Carriage Paid To Place of DestinationCIP Carriage & Insurance Paid To Place of DestinationGroup 2: Rules for sea and inland waterwaysIncoterms Incoterms Description Location 2CFR Cost & Freight Port of DestinationCIF Cost Insurance & Freight Port of Destination

PaymentTerms.title: Payment Terms
PaymentTerms.description:
Terms of Payment Key  
Key for defining payment terms composed of cash discount percentages and payment periods.  
It is used in sales orders, purchase orders, and invoices. Terms of payment provide information for:Cash managementDunning proceduresPayment transactionsData can be entered in the field for the terms of payment key in various ways as you enter a business transaction:In most business transactions, the system defaults the key specified in the master record of the customer/vendor in question.In some transactions (for example, credit memos), however, the system does not default the key from the master record. Despite this, you can use the key from the customer/vendor master record by entering "*" in the field.Regardless of whether or not a key is defaulted from the master record, you can manually enter a key during document entry at:item level in sales ordersheader level in purchase orders and invoicesMaster records have separate areas for Financial Accounting, Sales, and Purchasing. You can specify different terms of payment keys in each of these areas. When you then enter a business transaction, the application in question will use the key specified in its area of the master record.

CashDiscount1Days.title: Days 1
CashDiscount1Days.description:
Cash discount days 1  
Period within which a payment must be made in order to take advantage of the first cash discount terms.

CashDiscount2Days.title: Days 2
CashDiscount2Days.description:
Cash discount days 2  
Period within which a payment must be made in order to take advantage of the second cash discount terms.

CashDiscount1Percent.title: Disc.percent 1
CashDiscount1Percent.description:
Cash discount percentage 1  
Cash discount percentage rate applied to the shortest payment period.

CashDiscount2Percent.title: Disc.percent 2
CashDiscount2Percent.description:
Cash Discount Percentage 2  
Cash discount percentage rate applied to the second payment period.

NetPaymentDays.title: Days Net
NetPaymentDays.description:
Net Payment Terms Period  
Standard settlement period (in days).

QuotationLatestSubmissionDate.title: Quotation Deadline
QuotationLatestSubmissionDate.description:
Deadline for Submission of Bid/Quotation  
Date by which the supplier is to submit the quotation.

BindingPeriodValidityEndDate.title: Binding Period
BindingPeriodValidityEndDate.description:
Binding Period for Quotation  
Date until which the quotation submitted is to be regarded as binding.

TargetAmount.title: Target Value
TargetAmount.description:
Target Value for Header Area per Distribution  
Displays the target value that is entered for each distribution at header level for a central contract.  
You specify this value manually for each distribution at header level of the central contract.If the specified value is exceeded, the user sees a message when creating the contract release order.

CorrespncInternalReference.title: Our Reference
CorrespncInternalReference.description:
Your company's internal reference number or code.  
This usually identifies the person responsible for the purchasing document in your company. The reference number/code often consists of the relevant person's initials.

RequestForQuotationName.title: RFQ Description
RequestForQuotationName.description: Short description or the title of the RFQ

QuotationEarliestSubmsnDate.title: Quotation Start Date
QuotationEarliestSubmsnDate.description: The date as of which Quotations can be submitted

IsEndOfPurposeBlocked.title: Business Purp Compl
IsEndOfPurposeBlocked.description:
Business Purpose Completed  
Indicates whether the end of purpose (EoP) has been reached.  
The EoP is the point in time for a data set when the processing of personal data is no longer required for the primary business purpose. After the EoP has been reached, the data is blocked and can only be accessed by users with special authorization

CompanyCode.description: The company code is an organizational unit within financial accounting.

PurchasingDocumentCategory.description:

It is used in sales orders, purchase orders, and invoices. Terms of payment provide information for:Cash managementDunning proceduresPayment transactionsData can be entered in the field for the terms of payment key in various ways as you enter a business transaction:In most business transactions, the system defaults the key specified in the master record of the customer/vendor in question.In some transactions (for example, credit memos), however, the system does not default the key from the master record. Despite this, you can use the key from the customer/vendor master record by entering "*" in the field.Regardless of whether or not a key is defaulted from the master record, you can manually enter a key during document entry at:item level in sales ordersheader level in purchase orders and invoicesMaster records have separate areas for Financial Accounting, Sales, and Purchasing. You can specify different terms of payment keys in each of these areas. When you then enter a business transaction, the application in question will use the key specified in its area of the master record.

CashDiscount1Days.title: Days 1
CashDiscount1Days.description:
Cash discount days 1  
Period within which a payment must be made in order to take advantage of the first cash discount terms.

CashDiscount2Days.title: Days 2
CashDiscount2Days.description:
Cash discount days 2  
Period within which a payment must be made in order to take advantage of the second cash discount terms.

CashDiscount1Percent.title: Disc.percent 1
CashDiscount1Percent.description:
Cash discount percentage 1  
Cash discount percentage rate applied to the shortest payment period.

CashDiscount2Percent.title: Disc.percent 2
CashDiscount2Percent.description:
Cash Discount Percentage 2  
Cash discount percentage rate applied to the second payment period.

NetPaymentDays.title: Days Net
NetPaymentDays.description:
Net Payment Terms Period  
Standard settlement period (in days).

QuotationLatestSubmissionDate.title: Quotation Deadline
QuotationLatestSubmissionDate.description:
Deadline for Submission of Bid/Quotation  
Date by which the supplier is to submit the quotation.

BindingPeriodValidityEndDate.title: Binding Period
BindingPeriodValidityEndDate.description:
Binding Period for Quotation  
Date until which the quotation submitted is to be regarded as binding.

TargetAmount.title: Target Value
TargetAmount.description:
Target Value for Header Area per Distribution  
Displays the target value that is entered for each distribution at header level for a central contract.  
You specify this value manually for each distribution at header level of the central contract.If the specified value is exceeded, the user sees a message when creating the contract release order.

CorrespncInternalReference.title: Our Reference
CorrespncInternalReference.description:
Your company's internal reference number or code.  
This usually identifies the person responsible for the purchasing document in your company. The reference number/code often consists of the relevant person's initials.

RequestForQuotationName.title: RFQ Description
RequestForQuotationName.description: Short description or the title of the RFQ

QuotationEarliestSubmsnDate.title: Quotation Start Date
QuotationEarliestSubmsnDate.description: The date as of which Quotations can be submitted

IsEndOfPurposeBlocked.title: Business Purp Compl
IsEndOfPurposeBlocked.description:
Business Purpose Completed  
Indicates whether the end of purpose (EoP) has been reached.  
The EoP is the point in time for a data set when the processing of personal data is no longer required for the primary business purpose. After the EoP has been reached, the data is blocked and can only be accessed by users with special authorization

RequestForQuotation.title: Purchasing Document
RequestForQuotation.description:
Purchasing Document Number  
Alphanumeric key uniquely identifying the document.

PartnerCounter.title: Partner counter
PartnerCounter.description:
The sequential number that the system applies when there is more than one partner for a particular partner function.  
When you create a sales order for a particular customer, there may be more than one ship-to party defined. The different ship-to parties are numbered sequentially.

PartnerFunction.title: Partner Function
PartnerFunction.description: The abbreviated form of the name that identifies the partner function.

Supplier.title: Supplier
Supplier.description:
Account Number of Supplier  
Specifies an alphanumeric key that uniquely identifies the supplier in the SAP system.

RequestForQuotation.title: Purchasing Document
RequestForQuotation.description:
Purchasing Document Number  
Alphanumeric key uniquely identifying the document.

PartnerCounter.title: Partner counter
PartnerCounter.description:
The sequential number that the system applies when there is more than one partner for a particular partner function.  
When you create a sales order for a particular customer, there may be more than one ship-to party defined. The different ship-to parties are numbered sequentially.

PartnerFunction.title: Partner Function
PartnerFunction.description: The abbreviated form of the name that identifies the partner function.

Supplier.title: Supplier
Supplier.description:
Account Number of Supplier  
Specifies an alphanumeric key that uniquely identifies the supplier in the SAP system.

PartnerFunction.title: Partner Function
PartnerFunction.description: The abbreviated form of the name that identifies the partner function.

Supplier.title: Supplier
Supplier.description:
Account Number of Supplier  
Specifies an alphanumeric key that uniquely identifies the supplier in the SAP system.

RequestForQuotationItem.title: RFQ Item
RequestForQuotationItem.description: Item Number of Request For Quotation

RequestForQuotation.title: Purchasing Document
RequestForQuotation.description:
Purchasing Document Number  
Alphanumeric key uniquely identifying the document.

PurchasingDocumentCategory.title: Purch. Doc. Category
PurchasingDocumentCategory.description:
Purchasing Document Category  
Allows a distinction to be made between the various purchasing documents.

Material.title: Material
Material.description:
Material Number  
Alphanumeric key uniquely identifying the material.

ManufacturerMaterial.title: Material
ManufacturerMaterial.description:
Material number  
Uniquely identifies a material.  
This field is also used for MPN materials.

ManufacturerPartNmbr.title: Mfr Part Number
ManufacturerPartNmbr.description:
Manufacturer Part Number  
Specifies the number used by the manufacturer, or also by the supplier, to manage a material.

Manufacturer.title: Manufacturer
Manufacturer.description:
Manufacturer number  
Specifies the manufacturer of the MPN material or the manufacturer's plant for which a manufacturer master record has been created.

MaterialGroup.title: Material Group
MaterialGroup.description:
Key that you use to group together several materials or services with the same attributes, and to assign them to a particular material group.  
You can use material groups to:Restrict the scope of analysesSearch specifically for material master records via search helps

Plant.title: Plant
Plant.description:
Specifies the key for a production facility or branch office within the company (that is, the company code).  
You use the plant key to determine, for instance, which plant is to receive ordered goods.

ManualDeliveryAddressID.title: Address
ManualDeliveryAddressID.description: Manual address number in purchasing document item

IncotermsClassification.title: Incoterms
IncotermsClassification.description:
Incoterms (Part 1)  
Commonly used trading terms that comply with the standards established by the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC).  
Incoterms specify internationally recognized procedures that the shipper and the receiving party must follow for the shipping transaction to be completed successfully.If goods are shipped through a port of departure, the appropriate Incoterm might be: FOB ("Free On Board"). You can provide further details (for example, the name of the port) in the secondary Incoterm field: FOB Boston, for example.

IncotermsTransferLocation.title: Incoterms (Part 2)
IncotermsTransferLocation.description:
Additional information for the primary Incoterm.  
If the primary Incoterm is, for example, FOB ("Free on Board"), then the second field provides details of the port from which the delivery leaves (for example, "FOB Boston").

IncotermsLocation1.title: Incoterms Location 1
IncotermsLocation1.description:
Provides additional information for the primary Incoterm. For Incoterms 2010, this field represents:  
1. For sea and inland waterway transport - Port of Shipment2. For any mode of transport - Place of Delivery 2010Incoterms are divided as follows:Group 1: Rules for any mode or modes of transport (including by vessel)Incoterms Incoterms Description  Location 1 EXW Ex Works  Place of DeliveryFCA Free Carrier  Place of DeliveryCPT Carriage Paid To  Place of DestinationCIP Carriage & Insurance Paid To  Place of DestinationDAF Delivered at Frontier  Place of DeliveryDDP Delivered Duty Paid  Place of DestinationDDU Delivered Duty Unpaid  Place of DestinationGroup 2: Rules for sea and inland waterwaysIncoterms Incoterms Description Location 1 FAS Free Alongside Ship Port of ShipmentFOB Free On Board Port of ShipmentCFR Cost & Freight Port of DestinationCIF Cost Insurance & Freight Port of DestinationDEQ Delivered Eq Quay (Duty Paid) Port of DestinationDES Delivered Ex Ship Port of DestinationIf the primary incoterm is specified as FOB “Free on Board”, the second field provides details of the port from which the delivery leaves, such as FOB Boston.

IncotermsLocation2.title: Incoterms Location 2
IncotermsLocation2.description:
Provides additional information for the Incoterms. This field is only available for C-Clauses (if customized appropriately). Note the following for the incoterms versions below:  
No Version:This field is disabledIncoterm Version 2000This field is disabled as part of standard delivery unless a customer decides to enable it by the way of Customizing for Sales and Distribution under Master Data -> Business Partners -> Customers -> Billing Document -> Incoterms -> Map Incoterms to Versions.Incoterm Version 2010For this version, the field represents:Sea and inland waterway transport - Port of DestinationAny mode of transport - Place of Destination2010 Incoterms are divided as follows:Group 1: Rules for any mode or modes of transport (including by vessel)Incoterms Incoterms Description Location 2CPT Carriage Paid To Place of DestinationCIP Carriage & Insurance Paid To Place of DestinationGroup 2: Rules for sea and inland waterwaysIncoterms Incoterms Description Location 2CFR Cost & Freight Port of DestinationCIF Cost Insurance & Freight Port of Destination

OrderQuantityUnit.title: Order Unit
OrderQuantityUnit.description:
Purchase Order Unit of Measure  
Specifies the unit of measure in which the material is ordered.

OrderItemQtyToBaseQtyNmrtr.title: Equal To
OrderItemQtyToBaseQtyNmrtr.description:
Numerator for Conversion of Order Unit to Base Unit  
Numerator of the quotient for conversion of the order unit into the base unit.  
If the order unit is kilogram, and the base unit is piece, and if one kilogram equals 4 pieces, the conversion factor is:4 KG (numerator) --> 1 PC (denominator).NoteYou can only enter whole numbers in the numerator and denominator fields. That is to say, if 3.14 m2 equals one piece, you must enter whole number multiples thereof (314 m2 = 100 pc). The quotient is thus 100/314, the numerator 100, and the denominator 314.

OrderItemQtyToBaseQtyDnmntr.title: Denominator
OrderItemQtyToBaseQtyDnmntr.description:
Denominator for Conversion of Order Unit to Base Unit  
Denominator of the quotient expressing the ratio  
base unit : order unit.To convert a quantity, whose unit of measure is not the same as the base unit of measure, into the base unit of measure, the system requires a quotient:Quantity (in alternative unit of measure) = quotient * quantity (in base unit of measure)Enter the number of units of the alternative unit of measure (denominator) that corresponds to the number of units of the base unit of measure (numerator).The alternative unit of measure is kilogram (kg). The base unit of measure is piece (PC). 5 kg correspond to 3 pieces.5 kg = 3 PC   =>   1 kg = 3/5 PCIn this case, the quotient is therefore 3/5 (the numerator being 3 and the denominator 5).You may enter only whole numbers in the numerator and denominator fields; that is, if 3.14 m² correspond to one piece, you must enter integer multiples (314 m² = 100 PC). In this case, the quotient is therefore 100/314 (the numerator being 100 and the denominator 314).

BaseUnit.title: Base Unit of Measure
BaseUnit.description:
Unit of measure in which the stocks of the material are managed. The system converts all quantities that you enter in other units into the base unit.  
In inventory management the base unit is the same as the stockkeeping unit.The simulated price relates to this unit of measure.

PurchaseRequisition.title: Purchase Requisition
PurchaseRequisition.description:
Purchase Requisition Number  
Alphanumeric key uniquely identifying the document.

PurchaseRequisitionItem.title: Item of requisition
PurchaseRequisitionItem.description:
Item number of purchase requisition  
Specifies the number that uniquely identifies an item in .

IsInfoRecordUpdated.title: Info Record Update
IsInfoRecordUpdated.description:
Indicator: Update Info Record  
Determines whether:  
The purchasing info record for this supplier and material is to refer to this PO item, andThe item is to be valid for the entire purchasing organization or just for the plant.The indicator determines which prices and conditions are suggested in future PO items.Prices and conditions can apply to an entire purchasing organization or to a single plant within a purchasing organization.For example, if you create a purchase order for a plant for which an info record has been defined at plant level, the purchase order is based on the conditions in the plant info record and not on the conditions that apply to the purchasing organization.Enter the relevant plant key:AUpdating of the document number is effected at plant level as long as there is a purchasing info record at plant level. Otherwise the document number is updated at purchasing organization level.BUpdating is effected at plant level if plant conditions are allowed for the plant.CUpdating is effected without plant data if plant conditions are not necessary for the plant.The level at which updating of the document number may be effected is defined for each plant.

RequestForQuotationItem.title: RFQ Item
RequestForQuotationItem.description: Item Number of Request For Quotation

RequestForQuotation.title: Purchasing Document
RequestForQuotation.description:
Purchasing Document Number  
Alphanumeric key uniquely identifying the document.

innererror.description: The structure of this object is service-specific

top.name: $top
top.description: Show only the first n items, see [Paging - Top](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=66)

skip.name: $skip
skip.description: Skip the first n items, see [Paging - Skip](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)
